name: Seychelles & Mascarene Islands Music
description: Styles from La Réunion, Mauritius, Rodrigues, and Seychelles.

children.name: Maloya
children.description: Originated in slave communities on La Réunion; based on a call and response structure and use of traditional instruments.

children.name: Moutya
children.description: Tradition that originated in Seychelles among Creole slaves, similar to Séga, although rawer and played only on large flat drums made from goatskin.

children.name: Santé engagé
children.description: Emerged in Mauritius in the 1970s, blending the popular Séga style with outside influences.

children.name: Séga
children.description: Mascarene Islands and Seychelles genre featuring a distinctive 6/8 rhythm.
